definition: house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: The most interesting ornamentation is found on a frieze and an arch-stone.
sentences.chinese: 最有趣的装饰是发现雕刻的柱子和一个石头牌楼。

sentences.english: The decorated archway of village ZhouZhuang seems to stand at the entrance of the attraction as well as my mind.
sentences.chinese: 那周庄的牌楼似乎也很魁伟地立在入口处。

sentences.english: Arches outside the east gate of Sianfu.
The other name of Paifang Is Chinese Archway (Pailou), which is special type branch of Chinese ancient architecture.
sentences.chinese: 牌坊又名牌楼，是中国古代建筑中的一个特殊类别。

sentences.english: The inscription seems to have been worn away.
I would vote for wong kee restaurant for collective memories.
sentences.chinese: 英国华人的集团回忆，我会选唐人街的牌楼。

sentences.english: In the south of Quanfu road where the new and old township border lied , stands a archaize arched.
sentences.chinese: 全福路南端的新老镇区交界处，矗立着一座仿古牌楼。

sentences.english: The beautiful gate below can be seen nearby.
sentences.chinese: 在这附近可看到漂亮的牌楼。

sentences.english: We will work into the night to erect a barrier around the archway.
sentences.chinese: 我们将连夜施工，修起一个围挡将牌楼圈起来。

sentences.english: The villagers put up a tall archway to celebrate Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 春节，村子里搭起了高高的彩牌楼。

definition: a screen wall across the gate of a house (for privacy)
area above the lintel of a doorway
spirit wall (screen wall used to shield an entrance in traditional Chinese architecture)
temple to Kuixing, Daoist God of fate
variant of 匾額|匾额[bian3 e2]
